p: Apparently, under M +, the E. adenophorum was significantly greater than the A. annua in length under the Cu and Su, and in surface area and volume under the Cu, Su and Nu treatments; but the average diameter of E. adenophorum was lower than A. annua under the Cu and Su treatments; under M -, the volume of E. adenophorum was lower than A. annua under the Cu treatment ( Fig 3aâ€“3d). These results indicate that AM fungi can promote the growth and development of the root of E. adenophorum and A. annua by changing the root traits and that the root system of E. adenophorum experienced greater changes in traits reflecting greater enhanced competitiveness than A. annua when the two species compete for common nutrients in the middle compartment via their mycelium.
